# Instructions

Review the current state of the page and all other information to find the best
possible next action to accomplish your goal. Your answer will be interpreted
and executed by a program, make sure to follow the formatting instructions.

# Goal

Enter text into a search field and submit it.

# Current page Accessibility Tree

[E1] textbox '' (Input field)
[E2] button 'Submit'

# Next action

You will now think step by step and produce your next best action. Reflect on your past actions, any resulting error message, the current state of the page before deciding on your next action.

The goal requires entering text and submitting. This involves two actions: filling a textbox and clicking a button. However, I can only execute ONE action per step. I must break this into sequential steps. I will start with the first action: filling the textbox element (role=textbox).

```python
fill("E1", "search term")
```

# Instructions

Review the current state of the page and all other information to find the best
possible next action to accomplish your goal. Your answer will be interpreted
and executed by a program, make sure to follow the formatting instructions.

# Goal

Submit the search that was previously entered.

# Current page Accessibility Tree

[E1] textbox 'search term' (Input field)
[E2] button 'Submit'

# Action History

fill("E1", "search term")

# Next action

You will now think step by step and produce your next best action. Reflect on your past actions, any resulting error message, the current state of the page before deciding on your next action.

The textbox has been filled. Now I need to submit by clicking the button. I will execute one action: clicking the button element (role=button).

```python
click("E2")
```

possible next action to accomplish your goal. Your answer will be interpreted
and executed by a program, make sure to follow the formatting instructions.

Perform multiple actions: fill field A, click button B, and interact with element C.

The goal requires multiple actions, but I can only execute ONE action per step. I must break this into sequential steps, executing one action at a time. I will start with the first action: filling the textbox.

```python
fill("E1", "value")
```

# Instructions

Review the current state of the page and all other information to find the best
possible next action to accomplish your goal. Your answer will be interpreted
and executed by a program, make sure to follow the formatting instructions.

# Goal

Enter text into an input field.

# Current page Accessibility Tree

[E1] textbox '' (Input field)
[E2] button 'Action'

# Error message from last action

ValueError: Received a multi-action, only single-actions are allowed.

# Next action

You will now think step by step and produce your next best action. Reflect on your past actions, any resulting error message, the current state of the page before deciding on your next action.

I received an error because I tried to execute multiple actions in one step. The system only allows ONE action per step. I must break multi-step goals into separate sequential actions. I will execute one action: filling the textbox element.

```python
fill("E1", "text")
```

# Instructions

Review the current state of the page and all other information to find the best
possible next action to accomplish your goal. Your answer will be interpreted
and executed by a program, make sure to follow the formatting instructions.

# Goal

Enter text into a field.

# Current page Accessibility Tree

[E1] textbox '' (Input field)
[E2] button 'Action'

# Error message from last action

Error: Element is not an <input>, <textarea>, <select> or [contenteditable]. Element is a button, not an input field.

# Next action

You will now think step by step and produce your next best action. Reflect on your past actions, any resulting error message, the current state of the page before deciding on your next action.

I made an error - I tried to use fill() on a button element. Universal rule: fill() can ONLY be used on elements with role=textbox, role=input, or type=text/textarea. Buttons (role=button) are for clicking only, not for typing. I must check the accessibility tree to find the element with role=textbox. Element E1 has role=textbox, so I will use fill() on that element.

```python
fill("E1", "text")
```

I need to enter text. Universal rule: to enter text, I must use fill() on an element with role=textbox, not on button elements. Buttons (role=button) are for clicking only. Looking at the accessibility tree, element E1 has role=textbox, so I will use fill() on that element.

```python
fill("E1", "input value")
```
